intro: Malvaviscus puniceus, commonly known as the scarlet bower vine, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a vigorous climber with showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, attracting hummingbirds and other pollinators. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. Malvaviscus puniceus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
